titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the United States Catholic China Bureau Records
United States Catholic China Bureau Records
titlestmt.author: Compiled by Lucas L. Schulte and Martha Lund Smalley

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Tuesday April 23, 2019 at 22:01

did.unittitle: United States Catholic China Bureau Records
did.abstract: This record group consists of periodicals on China collected by the United States Catholic China Bureau as subject resources for its work, as well as material documenting the program activities of the Bureau. These periodicals document the Christian church in contemporary China.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: United States Catholic China Bureau Records (RG 194), Special Collections, Yale Divinity School Library.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: The United States Catholic China Bureau exists to foster communication and friendship with the people of China through sharing the values of the Gospel of Jesus Christ. It promotes understanding among American Catholics about the Catholic Church and the situation of Catholic communities in China. It seeks to engage the American Catholics in a new missionary partnership with Chinese Catholics.

Founded in 1989, with the encouragement of the National Conference of Catholic Bishops, the Bureau is sponsored by a cross-section of Roman Catholic organizations and individuals in the United States who share its purposes and goals. The USCCB offices is at Seton Hall University in South Orange, New Jersey.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The periodicals in Series I have been transferred to the Yale Divinity Library because of space restrictions at the USCCB office, and because it was thought that the materials would be more accessible to researchers if housed at an academic library.
Series II has been established to house a growing collection of material documenting the work of the Bureau.
